1st level

$$
Positional \_ Improvement\_\textit{T+1}_{ij} = 
\alpha_{0j} + \alpha_{1j}*Speed\_\textit{T}_{ij} + \alpha_{2j}*Speed\_of\_Environment \_ \textit{T}_{ij} + \epsilon^\alpha_{ij}
$$

$$
Speed\_{T}_{ij} = \beta_{0j} + \beta_{1j}*Speed\_\textit{T-1}_{ij} + \beta_{2j}*Speed\_of\_Environment\_\textit{T-1}_{ij} + \epsilon^\beta_{ij}
$$


$$
Speed\_of\_Environment_\_{T}_{ij} = \gamma_{0j} + \gamma_{1j}*Speed\_\textit{T-1}_{ij} + \gamma_{2j}*Speed\_of\_Environment\_\textit{T-1}_{ij} + \epsilon^\gamma_{ij}
$$
2nd level

$$
\alpha_{0j} = \kappa_{00} + u_{0j} \\
\alpha_{1j} = \kappa_{10} + u_{1j} \\
\alpha_{2j} = \kappa_{20}  \\
\beta_{nj} = \lambda_{n0}, \ for\ n ∈ \ {0,1,2} \\ 
\gamma_{nj} = \delta_{n0},  \ for\ n ∈ \ {0,1,2}
$$

where an observation for the individual jockey at a quarter of a second $i$ (across all races) is nested within a jockey $j$;

$\alpha, \beta, \gamma$ with subscripts are regression parameter estimates with $\kappa, \lambda, \delta$ being their jockey-level intercepts;

$u_{0j}$ and $u_{1j}$ are random intercept and slope parameters respectively for the impact of jockeys'/horses' speed on the performance outcome;

$\epsilon$ is a normally distributed error term.
